c74object.name: cage.sdif.chordseq.unpack
c74object.digest: Unpack parameters of a chord sequence SDIF analysis
c74object.description: Outputs the stream-wise separate parameters from a chord sequence SDIF analysis

inlet.description: The SDIF analysis containing partial tracking information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the unpacked information obtained from the most recently input analysis llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll is expected to contain the llll form of a chordseq tracking SDIF analysis (as the one output by bach.readsdif). The separate parameters of such analysis are then output - respectively, from rightmost to leftmost outlet: phases, amplitudes, frequencies, onsets (ms) and stream IDs. Except for stream IDs, which are a plain list, all other parameters are formatted stream-wise, i.e. with a sublist for each stream, and then onset-wise, i.e. with a sublist for each time instant. Onsets, on the other hand, only have the stream sublist level.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: SDIF analysis as llll. The SDIF analysis containing partial tracking information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.
